title: Calories in Grilled Cheese Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in grilled cheese, including macros, full nutrition breakdown per sandwich, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard: 2 slices white bread, 2 slices American cheese, 1 tbsp butter for grilling; cooked on stovetop.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, cheese brand, butter amount, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A classic grilled cheese sandwich has about 350 kcal and 12 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard version with white bread and American cheese.

faqs.q: What's the protein in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: About 12 g protein per sandwich, mostly from the cheese.

faqs.q: Are grilled cheese sandwiches high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 850 mg per sandwich due to cheese and bread.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Use low-fat cheese, whole grain bread, or skip butter for ~100-150 kcal savings.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: White bread adds more carbs and calories; whole wheat is similar but with more fiber.
